title:
**Yuanxu Dong, PhD**
Humboldt Fellowship for Postdoc
text:
About Me


Marine Scientist | Early Career Researcher


2024–2026: Postdoc, GEOMAR & Heidelberg University


2019–2023: PhD, University of East Anglia & PML


2016–2019: Master, Ocean University of China


Research Interests



Air–sea gas exchange


Ocean carbon cycle


Eddy covariance



Academic Responsibilities



Co-chair of SOLAS ECSC


Editor of Earth Observation



Contact


Email: ydong@geomar.de


ResearchGate: Profile

title:
**Yuanxu Dong, PhD**
Humboldt Fellowship for Postdoc
text:
I have published 10 peer-reviewed scientific papers, including six first-author publications.

Dong, Y., Yang, M., Bell, T. G., Marandino, A. C., Woolf, D. K. (2025).
Asymmetric bubble-mediated gas transfer enhances global ocean CO₂ uptake.
Nature Communications*, 16, 10595.
[IF = 15.7]
Dong, Y., Bakker, D. C. E., Bell, T. G., Yang, M., Landschützer, P., Hauck, J., Rödenbeck, C., Kitidis, V., Bushinsky, S. M., & Liss, P. S. (2024).
Direct observational evidence of strong CO₂ uptake in the Southern Ocean.
Science Advances*, 10(30), eadn5781.
[IF = 14.1]
Dong, Y., et al. (2024).
Accuracy of ocean CO₂ uptake estimates at risk due to reduced data collection.
Geophysical Research Letters*, 51, e2024GL108502.
[IF = 4.6]
Dong, Y., et al. (2022).
Update on the temperature corrections of global air–sea CO₂ flux estimates.
Global Biogeochemical Cycles*, 36(9), e2022GB007360.
[IF = 5.5]
Dong, Y., et al. (2021).
Near-surface stratification due to ice melt biases Arctic air–sea CO₂ flux estimates.
Geophysical Research Letters*, 48(22), 1–10.
[IF = 4.6]
Dong, Y., et al. (2021).
Uncertainties in eddy covariance air–sea CO₂ flux measurements and implications for gas transfer velocity parameterisations.
Atmospheric Chemistry and Physics*, 21(10), 8089–8110.
[IF = 5.8]
Yang, M., Dong, Y., et al. (2024).
Deciphering the variability in air–sea gas transfer due to sea state and wind history.
PNAS Nexus, pgae389.
Workman, E., Dong, Y., et al. (2024).
Methane emissions from seabed to atmosphere in polar oceans revealed by direct methane flux measurements.
Journal of Geophysical Research: Atmospheres, 129, e2023JD040632.
Yang, M., Dong, Y., et al. (2022).
Global synthesis of air–sea CO₂ transfer velocity estimates from ship-based eddy covariance measurements.
Frontiers in Marine Science, 9, 826421.
Zhao, D., Dong, Y., et al. (2018).
Relationship between turbulent energy dissipation and gas transfer through the air–sea interface.
Tellus B: Chemical and Physical Meteorology, 70(1), 1–11.

title:
**Yuanxu Dong, PhD**
Humboldt Fellowship for Postdoc
text:
Manuscripts Under Review

Dong, Y., Jähne, B., Woolf, D. K., Krall, K. E., Yang, M., Czerski, H., Liang, J., Brooks, I. M., McNeil, C. L., Wanninkhof, R., Ho, D. T., Atamanchuk, D., & Marandino, C. A.
The role of bubbles in air–sea gas exchange: A critical review.
Reviews of Geophysics* (under review).
https://doi.org/10.22541/essoar.175611263.31332921/v1
[IF = 37.3]
Dong, Y., Marandino, C. A., Dobashi, R., Ho, D. T., Rehder, G., Bittig, H. C., … & Engel, A. (2026).
Mechanisms of air–sea CO₂ exchange in the central Baltic Sea.
EGUsphere*, 1–44.
https://doi.org/10.5194/egusphere-2025-6095
Dong, Y., Yang, M. & Bell, T. G.
Advancements in air–sea gas transfer velocity estimations from eddy covariance flux measurements.
In Cross-linking lab and field measurements and numerical modelling to identify and quantify the mechanisms of air–sea gas transfer,
edited by B. Jähne & K. Krall (under review).
Dobashi, R., Ho, D. T., Dong, Y., Marandino, C. A., & Czerski, H.
Air–sea gas exchange in the central Baltic Sea.
Geophysical Research Letters (under review).
Yin, H., Dong, Y., & Lu, X.
Assessing gas transfer velocity: The impact of ignoring skin temperature corrections.
Limnology and Oceanography Letters (under review).
Ford, D. J., Shutler, J. D., Holding, T., Sims, R. P., Ashton, I., Woolf, D. K., Goddijn-Murphy, L., Bakker, D. C. E., Sabine, C., Merchant, C. J., Embury, O., Dong, Y., & Wanninkhof, R.
Recalculating the Surface Ocean CO₂ Atlas (SOCAT) to a sea surface temperature climate data record.
Scientific Data (under review).
Yu, L., Josey, S., Bourassa, M., Dong, Y., & Behrangi, A.
Ocean–atmosphere fluxes of heat, moisture, momentum, aerosols, and gases.
Encyclopedia of Climate System Science (under review).
